title: "Understanding the Concept of Animal Magnetism in Ancient and Modern Science"
first_phrase: In the previous section, we have discussed how the operations between celestial bodies play a crucial role in determining the properties of matter and organized bodies on Earth. The  phenomenon of animal magnetism has been recognized by many ancient scholars, including Paracelse, who saw humans as microcosms. Mesmer, building on these ideas, called it 'magnétisme animal' and established its relationship with the universal fluid called 'magnétisme.' This energy can affect individuals even at a distance, without any intermediary body, and can be increased by mirrors and sound. In this final section, we will explore how this energy can be applied in healing practices.

last_phrase: In conclusion, the propositions of Mesmer and the opinions of the Ancients regarding animal magnetism shed light on the impressive capacity of the body to be influenced by external factors without the need for intermediaries. The properties of animal magnetism, its reflection in mirrors, and amplification through sound introduce a fascinating world that still requires further exploration.
